name: Diamond Head State Monument
description: With 15,952 reviews and a 4.7-star rating, Diamond Head State Monument (4200 Diamond Head Rd) has become a landmark for Honolulu dog owners. Open from 6am to 6pm daily, visits fit naturally into any dog owner's routine. The neighborhood offers dog owners more places to bring their pups: Honolulu Watershed Forest (0.0 miles) and Vickers Park (0.0 miles).

name: Honolulu Watershed Forest
description: With 4.7 stars across 2,207 reviews, Honolulu Watershed Forest has clearly won over Honolulu dog owners. Dog owners have embraced this park as a top choice for spending time with their pups. Keep the adventure going at other nearby dog parks like Diamond Head State Monument (0.0 miles) or Vickers Park (0.0 miles).

name: Waʻahila Ridge State Recreatio
description: Waʻahila Ridge State Recreatio (4.7 stars from 403 reviews) is a popular destination for Honolulu dog owners, located at 1600 Ruth Pl. Open from 7am to 7:45pm daily, dog owners can easily fit a visit into busy schedules. Looking for more places to take your pup? Manoa Valley District Park is another popular dog park just 0.9 miles away.

name: Mākālei Beach Park
description: Located at 3111 Diamond Head Rd in Honolulu, Mākālei Beach Park earns strong marks from local dog owners—4.7 stars from 384 reviews. Open from 5am to 12am daily, dog owners can plan visits around work or their pup's energy level. More dog-friendly parks nearby include Kapiʻolani Regional Park (0.6 miles) and Diamond Head Bark Park (1.3 miles)—perfect for pups who love adventure.

name: ‍ Na Pueo Mini Park
description: With 4.7 stars from 13 reviews, Na Pueo Mini Park at 1816 Alewa Dr has become a favorite among Honolulu dog owners. Open from 5am to 8pm daily, dog owners can plan visits around work or their pup's energy level. For variety, the neighborhood offers more dog parks to explore: Puʻunui Community Park (0.4 miles) and ʻĀlewa Neighborhood Park (0.9 miles).

name: Kaneohe Dog Park
description: With 4.6 stars from 11 reviews, Kaneohe Dog Park at 45-230 Kulauli St has become a favorite among Honolulu dog owners. For dog owners in the area, this park has become a trusted spot for time with their pups. Looking for more places to take your pup? Kawaikui Beach Park is another popular dog park just 2.4 miles away.

name: Diamond Head Bark Park
description: Dog owners in Honolulu have made Diamond Head Bark Park at 4155 Diamond Head Rd a go-to spot, rating it 4.6 stars across 192 reviews. Dog owners looking for a solid destination will find this park delivers. Other dog parks in the area include Hunakai Park (0.6 miles) and Kapiʻolani Regional Park (1.2 miles)—both great for exploring with your four-legged friend.

name: ‍ Kuliʻouʻou Beach Park
description: Kuliʻouʻou Beach Park at 100 Bay St is well-regarded by Honolulu dog owners, holding 4.6 stars across 425 reviews. Open from 5am to 10pm daily, the park works well for dog owners with different schedules. More dog-friendly parks nearby include Elaine Dobashi Dog Park (0.6 miles) and Niu Valley Neighborhood Park (1.3 miles)—perfect for pups who love adventure.

name: Kawaikui Beach Park
description: At 5475 Kalanianaʻole Hwy in Honolulu, Kawaikui Beach Park has built a loyal following—4.6 stars from 981 dog owner reviews. Open from 5am to 10pm daily, dog owners can easily fit a visit into busy schedules. Dog owners exploring the neighborhood can also bring their furry friends to Kaneohe Dog Park (2.4 miles).

name: Kapiʻolani Regional Park
description: Kapiʻolani Regional Park at 3840 Paki Ave in Honolulu has earned its reputation with 4.6 stars from 5,132 dog owner reviews. Open from 5am to 12am daily, dog owners have maximum flexibility to plan their visit. Nearby, Mākālei Beach Park (0.6 miles) gives dog owners even more space to explore with their four-legged companions.

name: Fort DeRussy Beach Park
description: With 5,377 reviews and a 4.6-star rating, Fort DeRussy Beach Park (2055 Kālia Rd) has become a landmark for Honolulu dog owners. Dog owners from across the area make this a destination worth the trip. Dog owners in this area are lucky to have more great dog parks nearby: Ala Wai Community Park (0.5 miles) and Ala Wai Neighborhood Park (0.6 miles).

name: Ala Moana Regional Park
description: Dog owners have made Ala Moana Regional Park at 1201 Ala Moana Blvd one of Honolulu's most popular destinations—4.6 stars from 6,746 visits. Open from 4am to 10pm daily, the park accommodates everything from early morning walks to evening adventures. The neighborhood offers dog owners more places to bring their pups: Victoria Ward Park (0.1 miles) and Kolowalu Park (0.3 miles).

name: ʻĀuwaiolimu Neighborhood Park
description: Located at 1848 Lusitana St, ʻĀuwaiolimu Neighborhood Park in Honolulu is rated 4.3 stars by 6 dog owners. Open from 5am to 10pm daily, the park gives dog owners in the neighborhood time to bring their pups. For dog owners who like to explore, ʻAʻala Park (0.9 miles) and Tamarind Park (0.9 miles) are both nearby parks to try with your dog.

name: Tamarind Park
description: At 1001 Bishop St, Tamarind Park has 4.4 stars based on 11 reviews from Honolulu dog owners. Open from 6am to 9pm daily, local dog owners have time to explore with their furry companions. For pups who want more adventure, Diamond Head State Monument is a nearby dog park worth visiting (0.5 miles).

name: Laukahi Park
description: Dog owners in Honolulu have rated Laukahi Park (1707 Laukahi St) 4.4 stars across 11 reviews. Open from 5am to 10pm daily, local dog owners have time to explore with their furry companions. For dog owners who like to explore, Kāmole Mini Park (0.3 miles) and Waiʻalae Beach Park (1.2 miles) are both nearby parks to try with your dog.

name: Victoria Ward Park
description: With 4.5 stars from 36 reviews, Victoria Ward Park at 1020 Auahi St has become a favorite among Honolulu dog owners. Dog owners in the area consistently choose this park as a go-to destination for their pups.
